00231 #if !defined(PCNT_CTRL_HYST)
00232 
00233 #define PCNT_INIT_DEFAULT                                                         \
00234 {                                                                                 \
00235   pcntModeDisable,                          /* Disabled by default. */            \
00236   _PCNT_CNT_RESETVALUE,                     /* Default counter HW reset value. */ \
00237   _PCNT_TOP_RESETVALUE,                     /* Default counter HW reset value. */ \
00238   false,                                    /* Use positive edge. */              \
00239   false,                                    /* Up-counting. */                    \
00240   false                                     /* Filter disabled. */                \
00241 }
00242 #else
00243 
00244 #define PCNT_INIT_DEFAULT                                                                      \
00245 {                                                                                              \
00246   pcntModeDisable,                          /* Disabled by default. */                         \
00247   _PCNT_CNT_RESETVALUE,                     /* Default counter HW reset value. */              \
00248   _PCNT_TOP_RESETVALUE,                     /* Default counter HW reset value. */              \
00249   false,                                    /* Use positive edge. */                           \
00250   false,                                    /* Up-counting. */                                 \
00251   false,                                    /* Filter disabled. */                             \
00252   false,                                    /* Hysteresis disabled. */                         \
00253   true,                                     /* Counter direction is given by CNTDIR. */        \
00254   pcntCntEventUp,                           /* Regular counter counts up on upcount events. */ \
00255   pcntCntEventNone,                         /* Auxiliary counter doesn't respond to events. */ \
00256   pcntPRSCh0,                               /* PRS channel 0 selected as S0IN. */              \
00257   pcntPRSCh0                                /* PRS channel 0 selected as S1IN. */              \
00258 }
00259 #endif

00460 __STATIC_INLINE void PCNT_IntClear(PCNT_TypeDef *pcnt, uint32_t flags)
00461 {

00465 /***************************************************************************/
00476 __STATIC_INLINE void PCNT_IntDisable(PCNT_TypeDef *pcnt, uint32_t flags)
00477 {
00478   pcnt->IEN &= ~flags;
00479 }
00480 
00481 /***************************************************************************/
00497 __STATIC_INLINE void PCNT_IntEnable(PCNT_TypeDef *pcnt, uint32_t flags)
00498 {
00499   pcnt->IEN |= flags;

00502 /***************************************************************************/
00516 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t PCNT_IntGet(PCNT_TypeDef *pcnt)
00517 {
00518   return pcnt->IF;

00520 
00521 /***************************************************************************/
00542 __STATIC_INLINE uint32_t PCNT_IntGetEnabled(PCNT_TypeDef *pcnt)
00543 {
00544   uint32_t tmp = 0U;
00545 
00546 
00547   /* Store pcnt->IEN in temporary variable in order to define explicit order
00548    * of volatile accesses. */
00549   tmp = pcnt->IEN;
00550 
00551   /* Bitwise AND of pending and enabled interrupts */
00552   return pcnt->IF & tmp;
00553 }
00554
